intro: Ammodenia, commonly known as the "false thistle," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are typically shrubs or subshrubs, characterized by their spiny leaves and showy yellow or orange flowers. Ammodenia species are native to Australia and are often found in arid or semi-arid regions. They have adapted to harsh environments with deep root systems and drought-resistant foliage. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in horticulture for their ornamental value.
